was it easy to port switch?
Entities move with pixel precision right?
Ah... okay
In our engine we haves tiles which are always aligned to the grid and entities things that move independent of
So tiles are either graphics or collisions. It usually makes sense ot make the aligned
game looks cool
Collision for entities can works in 2 steps: 1. collide with tiles. 2. other entities.
yours is probably faster too
An important optimization is always to make sure you can qucikly find nearby entities
Just using a simple grid structure already works well
So like, having a grid of 128x128 pixels and placing entities in tiles they overlap with
Doesn't have to be nearly as precise the graphic tiles
That's what we did at least
But yeah, there's many ways how to do it of course
can i see the game
Oh yeah, that's a good idea

I mean entity collisions is pretty much separated from our tiles

But we made the physics rather complicated
Our entities for instance have 3 coordimates and physics are kinda 3D
Which also makes rendering much more complicated
Do you use WebGL or Canvas2D?
We also use canvas2D
And that's a real pain if you want to render 3D content
Just as a warning

It's always good to manage the scope
